episodes.title: Touchdowns and Tithes
episodes.description:
We’re making up for skipping a week and blessing your feed with TWO episodes today! 🎉

I sit down with Hersal Pickett — a former member of my old church (but not my congregation) — who opens up about his time in the doomsday cult, the Worldwide Church of God. Like Pam in the last episode, Hersal caught on early that something wasn’t adding up.

Hersal is a UNC Chapel Hill basketball superfan 🏀, a proud husband and dad, a badass cancer survivor (say it with me: #fuckcancer), and quite possibly the nicest human alive. Case in point: I mispronounced his name the entire episode, and this man didn’t correct me once. 🙃 It’s HERSAL, y’all — not Hershal. My bad, friend.

Get into it, and enjoy! 🔥🎙️

If you or someone you know has been affected by cult involvement and is seeking help, the following resources are available:

Nikki G Speaks (Black owned religious trauma therapist)
https://www.nikkigspeaks.com/

Dr. Dylesia Trauma therapist (Black owned)
https://www.radicalchangetherapy.org/...

https://freedomofmind.com/

https://culteducation.com/

https://web.archive.org/web/201706281...

https://www.icsahome.com/

Thank you for listening.   / @blackandcultivated

episodes.title: Worldwide CULT of God?
episodes.description:
Only 3 more episodes left in Season 1 of Black and CULTivated.
And the final eps are diving headfirst into my own cult, The Worldwide Church of God. ⛪️🚩

First up, Ms. Pam Redd, a brilliant educator and musician who attended WWCG from age 5 to adulthood.

And chile, the stories she drops… 😳🔥 From meeting the church's leader Herbert W Armstrong and listening first hand to his racist ass sermons, to being disfellowshipped, — Pam does 👏🏾 not 👏🏾 hold 👏🏾 back. 

I’m so honored that she can use this platform to tell her story. 🖤

👉🏾 Link in bio to subscribe and catch all the final episodes! If you or someone you know has been affected by cult involvement and is seeking help, the following resources are available:

episodes.title: Announcement! 5/10/25
episodes.description: Hey fam, Just a heads up we are skipping a week so there will be no new episode on 5/11/25. There's only a few more episodes left in Season 1 of Black and CULTivated; we want to take the week to make sure all is good as the next episodes are about my cult!! So take the time to catch up, relisten to episodes, share, watch on YouTube and we'll be back on 5/ 19/25. I appreciate you all. Send us a text Thank you for listening. Watch this episode on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@blackandcultivated If you or someone you know has been affected by cult involvement and is seeking help, the following resources are available: Surviving Universal UK Nikki G Speaks (Black owned religious trauma therapist) Dr. Dylesia Trauma therapist (Black owned) Freedom of Mind Cult Education Institute Cult Awareness & Information Center International Cultic Studies Association Cult Escape Cult News 101

episodes.title: Cult Hopping?!! Cult Survivor turned Religious Trauma Coach Nikki G
episodes.description:
WTF is #culthopping ?!  Well, find out as we talk to our girl, Certified Trauma Recovery Coach, and cult expert Nikki G. 

After having been in several cults herself, Nikki took a step back, did the work, and wanted to be a voice as a Black woman in the often white dominated cult recovery community. So she is now making waves helping survivors recover and thrive after Narcissistic Abuse, Religious Trauma/Spiritual Abuse & Cult involvement/High Demand Groups. (If you need sis, her info is below.)

We gonna have to have a Part 2 with Nikki because this episode is just the tip of the iceberg!

episodes.title: Exorcisms, Holy Oil, Love Bombing Oh MY!
episodes.description:
This week, I'm talking to the QUEEN of taking down cults herself, our sis from across the pond: Rachael Reign.

Rachael was in the Universal Church of the Kingdom of God (aka UCKG)for 7 years,  recruited at just age 13. After breaking free, sis made it her mission to speak out against the injustices of this shady cult that goes by many names, by establishing Surviving Universal UK. 
https://www.instagram.com/survivinguniversaluk/?hl=en

Her work caught the eye of a BBC journalist and in 2023 a documentary aired exposing the UCKG cult. 
https://archive.org/details/bbc-panorama-universal-church-of-the-kingdom-of-god-uckg

Rachael Reign is doing the WORK! 

If you or someone you know has been affected by cult involvement and is seeking help, the following resources are available:

episodes.title: What is a CULT?!
episodes.description: Dr. Kamasi Hill is Black but NOT CULTivated. Dr. Hill was never part of a cult BUT he is a dope ass historian, theologian with a focus on African American religious history and award winning teacher. Plus, he is an amazing filmmaker (https://drkamasihill.com). In this episode, we give some context and discussion around how we define cult, especially from a Black folk/ Black church perspective. Send us a text Thank you for listening. Watch this episode on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@blackandcultivated If you or someone you know has been affected by cult involvement and is seeking help, the following resources are available: Nikki G Speaks (Black owned religious trauma therapist) Dr. Dylesia Trauma therapist (Black owned) Freedom of Mind Cult Education Institute Cult Awareness & Information Center International Cultic Studies Association Cult Escape Cult News 101

episodes.title: I Didn't Know It Was A Cult!
episodes.description:
This week, Black and CULTivated welcomes another bad ass, my lovely Filipina sister Giovannie Espiritu. Giovannie is an actor, activist, writer, and director who shares her experience of being in a biblical doomsday cult that was part of the “Home Church Movement.”  Through her story and her work as an artist, she aims to "break hearts wide open and create more moments of joy," showcasing her resilience and determination to overcome challenges. And that, is so damn beautiful.

episodes.title: I'm Betting On Me - Katurah Topps PART 1
episodes.description:
Katurah Topps is a resilient fighter and survivor. As a civil rights attorney from St. Louis, Missouri, now based in New York, Katurah is a true badass who fights against racially discriminatory systems at all levels. 

You may also know her from Survivor 45 where she was strategic and relentless #AF 

In part one of her story we'll learn about her journey in the dangerous cult House of Yahweh which took her and her family to Abeline Texas at just 9 years old. 

Part 2 will be released on April 7th, 2025

episodes.title: My Cult Has Snacks - Yvette Lovstad
episodes.description:
In the debut episode of Black and CULTivated,  meet the multi-talented Yvette Lovstad. Yvette joined and survived on just one but two cults - Scientology and One Taste. 

Yvette is a stand-up comedian, actor, and karaoke star. From her days as a guest VJ at MTV to her performances at renowned comedy clubs like Flappers, NY Comedy Club, Broadway Comedy Club, and The Comedy Store, Yvette Lovstad's comedic timing is unmatched. She's a brand of laughter! 

Tune in and learn Yvette's journey from borrowing money for expensive ass courses to "improve her life" to learning that "no is a complete sentence."

Thank you for listening.

episodes.title: Introducing: Black and CULTivated
episodes.description:
Introducing Black and CULTivated: The Groundbreaking Comedy Podcast Exploring the Stories of Black Cult Survivors premieres March 31, 2025. 

This limited-series weekly show delves into the experiences of Black and Brown individuals who have been part of or raised in cults, providing a platform for their stories to be heard and challenging stereotypes surrounding cult involvement within the Black community.

Hosted by actor/writer LaNisa Frederick, who was raised in a doomsday cult, Black and CULTivated aims to humanize the experiences of Black cult survivors through candid conversations, captivating guests, and humor. Each episode features a guest sharing their journey from entrance to exit of the cult, shedding light on a perspective often overlooked in mainstream media.

Join LaNisa and her guests on Black and CULTivated as they spark discussions, raise awareness, and let the world know that Black cult survivors are here to share their stories. Cause cults “ain’t just some white people shit.”

#cultlife #lanisa #podcast #podcasts
